page.title: 03VILLAGE HISTORY
page.content: Bishops Itchington is a very old village. It was included in the first {Domesday Book}which was put together in 1O86. When the first Domesday Book was made, our village was called{ {Icetone}but the name has changed over the years to{Uchenton Episcopi}then to {Bisshopesychengton.}It changed to{ {Fishers Itchington}and finally to{ {Bishops Itchington.}(The village was called other names as well.) We don't know exactly how old the village is but we do know that the population of the village increased dramatically when the{Blue Circle Cement Works}at Harbury opened. Nowadays the works are at the point of closing down. At present they are only used for processing the cement mined elsewhere. At the beginning of the century a lot of people moved to the village. Now the population is around two thousand.
